name: sysdig
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing sysdig cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`sysdig` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/draios/terraform-provider-sysdig).

duration.description: Time frame in seconds of the capture.

filename.description: Defines the name of the capture file.

filter.description: Additional filter to apply to the capture. For example: `proc.name contains nginx`.

append.description: Text to add after the alert template.

prepend.description: Text to add before the alert template.

title.description: Sets the title of the alert. It is commonly defined as `{{__alert_name__}} is {{__alert_status__}}`.

autosizeText.description:
If true, the text will be autosized in the panel.
This field is ignored for all panel types except `text`.

content.description:
This field is required if the panel type is `text`. It represents the 
text that will be displayed in the panel.

height.description: Height of the panel. Min value: 1.

name.description: Name of the panel.

posX.description: Position of the panel in the X axis. Min value: 0, max value: 23.

posY.description: Position of the panel in the Y axis. Min value: 0.

queries.description:
The PromQL query that will show information in the panel. 
If the type of the panel is `timechart`, then it can be specified multiple
times, to have multiple metrics in the same graph.
If the type of the panel is `number` then only one can be specified.
This field is required if the panel type is `timechart` or `number`.

transparentBackground.description:
If true, the panel will have a transparent background.
This field is ignored for all panel types except `text`.

type.description: Kind of panel, must be either `timechart`, `number` or `text`.

visibleTitle.description:
If true, the title of the panel will be displayed. Default: false.
This field is ignored for all panel types except `text`.

width.description: Width of the panel. Min value: 1, max value: 24.

promql.description:
The PromQL query. Must be a valid PromQL query with existing
metrics in Sysdig Monitor.

unit.description:
The type of metric for this query. Can be one of: `percent`, `data`, `data rate`, 
`number`, `number rate`, `time`.

comparator.description: Operator to relate the metric with some value. It is only required if the value to filter by is set, or the variable field is not set. Valid values are: `in`, `notIn`, `equals`, `notEquals`, `contains`, `notContains` and `startsWith`.

metric.description: Metric to scope by, common examples are `host.hostName`, `kubernetes.namespace.name` or `kubernetes.cluster.name`, but you can use all the Sysdig-supported values shown in the UI. Note that kubernetes-related values only appear when Sysdig detects Kubernetes metadata.

values.description: List of values to filter by, if comparator is set. If the comparator is not `in` or `notIn` the list must contain only 1 value.

variable.description: Assigns this metric to a value name and allows PromQL to reference it.

selection.description:
Sets up the defined Dashboard name as entrypoint.
Warning: This field must only be added if the `type` is "Dashboards".

type.description:
Main entrypoint for the team.
Valid options are: Explore, Dashboards, Events, Alerts, Settings.

email.description: The email of the user in the group.

role.description:
The role for the user in this group.
Valid roles are: ROLE_TEAM_STANDARD, ROLE_TEAM_EDIT, ROLE_TEAM_READ, ROLE_TEAM_MANAGER.
Default: ROLE_TEAM_STANDARD.

captures.description: Captures with Sysdig the stream of system calls:

container.description:
The action applied to container when this Policy is
triggered. Can be *stop*, *pause* or *kill*. If this is not specified,
no action will be applied at the container level.

secondsAfterEvent.description:
Captures the system calls for the amount
of seconds after the policy was triggered.

secondsBeforeEvent.description:
Captures the system calls during the
amount of seconds before the policy was triggered.

comps.description: Contains comparison operators that align 1-1 with the items in the fields property.

fields.description: Contains one or more fields that will extract a value from the syscall/k8s_audit events.

name.description: The name of the exception. Only used to provide a handy name, and to potentially link together values in a later rule that has `append = true`.

values.description: Contains tuples of values. Each item in the tuple should align 1-1 with the corresponding field and comparison operator. Since the value can be a string, a list of strings or a list of a list of strings, the value of this field must be supplied in JSON format. You can use the default `jsonencode` function to provide this value. See the usage example on the top.

matching.description: Defines if the path matches or not with the provided list. Default is true.
Defines if the path matches or not with the provided list. Default is true.
Defines if the port matches or not with the provided list. Default is true.
Defines if the port matches or not with the provided list. Default is true.

email.description: The email of the user in the group.

role.description:
The role for the user in this group.
Valid roles are: ROLE_TEAM_STANDARD, ROLE_TEAM_EDIT, ROLE_TEAM_READ, ROLE_TEAM_MANAGER.
Default: ROLE_TEAM_STANDARD.

provider.description:
The provider type for the sysdig package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

sysdig:Monitor/alertAnomaly:AlertAnomaly.description:
## Import

Anomaly Monitor alerts can be imported using the alert ID, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import sysdig:Monitor/alertAnomaly:AlertAnomaly example 12345
```

capture.description: Enables the creation of a capture file of the syscalls during the event.

customNotification.description: Allows to define a custom notification title, prepend and append text.

enabled.description: Boolean that defines if the alert is enabled or not. Defaults to true.

monitors.description: Array of metrics to monitor and alert on. Example: `["cpu.used.percent", "cpu.cores.used", "memory.bytes.used", "fs.used.percent", "thread.count", "net.request.count.in"]`.

multipleAlertsBies.description: List of segments to trigger a separate alert on. Example: `["kubernetes.cluster.name", "kubernetes.namespace.name"]`.

name.description: The name of the Monitor alert. It must be unique.

notificationChannels.description: List of notification channel IDs where an alert must be sent to once fired.

renotificationMinutes.description: Number of minutes for the alert to re-notify until the status is solved.

scope.description: Part of the infrastructure where the alert is valid. Defaults to the entire infrastructure.

severity.description:
Severity of the Monitor alert. It must be a value between 0 and 7,
with 0 being the most critical and 7 the less critical. Defaults to 4.

team.description: Team ID that owns the alert.

triggerAfterMinutes.description: Threshold of time for the status to stabilize until the alert is fired.

version.description: Current version of the resource in Sysdig Monitor.


capture.description: Enables the creation of a capture file of the syscalls during the event.

customNotification.description: Allows to define a custom notification title, prepend and append text.

enabled.description: Boolean that defines if the alert is enabled or not. Defaults to true.

entitiesToMonitors.description: List of metrics to monitor downtime and alert on. Example: `["kubernetes.namespace.name"]` to detect namespace removal or `["host.hostName"]` to detect host downtime.

notificationChannels.description: List of notification channel IDs where an alert must be sent to once fired.

renotificationMinutes.description: Number of minutes for the alert to re-notify until the status is solved.

scope.description: Part of the infrastructure where the alert is valid. Defaults to the entire infrastructure.

severity.description:
Severity of the Monitor alert. It must be a value between 0 and 7,
with 0 being the most critical and 7 the less critical. Defaults to 4.

team.description: Team ID that owns the alert.

triggerAfterMinutes.description: Threshold of time for the status to stabilize until the alert is fired.

triggerAfterPct.description: Below of this percentage of downtime the alert will be triggered. Defaults to 100.

sysdig:Monitor/alertEvent:AlertEvent.description:
## Import

Event Monitor alerts can be imported using the alert ID, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import sysdig:Monitor/alertEvent:AlertEvent example 12345
```

capture.description: Enables the creation of a capture file of the syscalls during the event.

customNotification.description: Allows to define a custom notification title, prepend and append text.

enabled.description: Boolean that defines if the alert is enabled or not. Defaults to true.

eventCount.description: Number of events to match with event_rel.

eventName.description: String that matches part of name, tag or the description of Sysdig Events.

eventRel.description: Relationship of the event count. It can be `>`, `>=`, `<`, `<=`, `=` or `!=`.

multipleAlertsBies.description: List of segments to trigger a separate alert on. Example: `["kubernetes.cluster.name", "kubernetes.namespace.name"]`.

name.description: The name of the Monitor alert. It must be unique.

notificationChannels.description: List of notification channel IDs where an alert must be sent to once fired.

renotificationMinutes.description: Number of minutes for the alert to re-notify until the status is solved.

scope.description: Part of the infrastructure where the alert is valid. Defaults to the entire infrastructure.

severity.description:
Severity of the Monitor alert. It must be a value between 0 and 7,
with 0 being the most critical and 7 the less critical. Defaults to 4.

source.description: Source of the event. It can be `docker` or `kubernetes`.

team.description: Team ID that owns the alert.

triggerAfterMinutes.description: Threshold of time for the status to stabilize until the alert is fired.

sysdig:Monitor/alertPromql:AlertPromql.description:
## Import

PromQL Monitor alerts can be imported using the alert ID, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import sysdig:Monitor/alertPromql:AlertPromql example 12345
```

customNotification.description: Allows to define a custom notification title, prepend and append text.

enabled.description: Boolean that defines if the alert is enabled or not. Defaults to true.

name.description: The name of the Monitor alert. It must be unique.

notificationChannels.description: List of notification channel IDs where an alert must be sent to once fired.

promql.description: PromQL-based metric expression to alert on. Example: `histogram_quantile(0.99, rate(etcd_http_successful_duration_seconds_bucket[5m]) > 0.15` or `predict_linear(sysdig_fs_free_bytes{fstype!~"tmpfs"}[1h], 24*3600) < 10000000000`.

renotificationMinutes.description: Number of minutes for the alert to re-notify until the status is solved.

severity.description:
Severity of the Monitor alert. It must be a value between 0 and 7,
with 0 being the most critical and 7 the less critical. Defaults to 4.

team.description: Team ID that owns the alert.

triggerAfterMinutes.description: Threshold of time for the status to stabilize until the alert is fired.

renotificationMinutes.description: Number of minutes for the alert to re-notify until the status is solved.

Severity of the Monitor alert. It must be a value between 0 and 7,
with 0 being the most critical and 7 the less critical. Defaults to 4.

triggerAfterMinutes.description: Threshold of time for the status to stabilize until the alert is fired.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AlertPromql resources.

customNotification.description: Allows to define a custom notification title, prepend and append text.

enabled.description: Boolean that defines if the alert is enabled or not. Defaults to true.

name.description: The name of the Monitor alert. It must be unique.

notificationChannels.description: List of notification channel IDs where an alert must be sent to once fired.

promql.description: PromQL-based metric expression to alert on. Example: `histogram_quantile(0.99, rate(etcd_http_successful_duration_seconds_bucket[5m]) > 0.15` or `predict_linear(sysdig_fs_free_bytes{fstype!~"tmpfs"}[1h], 24*3600) < 10000000000`.

renotificationMinutes.description: Number of minutes for the alert to re-notify until the status is solved.

severity.description:
Severity of the Monitor alert. It must be a value between 0 and 7,
with 0 being the most critical and 7 the less critical. Defaults to 4.

team.description: Team ID that owns the alert.

triggerAfterMinutes.description: Threshold of time for the status to stabilize until the alert is fired.

version.description: Current version of the resource in Sysdig Monitor.

## Import

Secure Benchmark Tasks can be imported using the `id`, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import sysdig:Secure/benchmarkTask:BenchmarkTask sample 1
```

enabled.description: Whether or not this task should be enabled. Default: `true`.

name.description: The unique identifier of the cloud account. e.g. for AWS: `123456789012`,

schedule.description: The schedule (as a cron expression: [Minute Hour Day DayOfWeek DayOfMonth]) on which this task should be run. The schedule may not be more frequent than once per day.

schema.description: The identifier of the benchmark schema of which to run. Possible values are: `aws_foundations_bench-1.3.0`, `gcp_foundations_bench-1.2.0`, `azure_foundations_bench-1.3.0`.

scope.description: The Sysdig scope expression on which to run this benchmark: e.g. `aws.accountId = \"123456789012\" and aws.region = \"us-west-2\"`. The labels available are `aws.accountId`, `aws.region`, `gcp.projectId` and `gcp.region`. Only the `=` and `and` operators are supported.

The rules can only be extended once, for example if there is an existing list called "foo", one can have another
append rule called "foo" but not a second one. By default this is false.

items.description: Elements in the list. Elements can be another lists.

name.description: The name of the Secure list. It must be unique if it's not in append mode.

sysdig:Secure/policy:Policy.description:
## Import

Secure runtime policies can be imported using the ID, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import sysdig:Secure/policy:Policy example 12345
```

enabled.description: Will secure process with this rule?. By default this is true.

name.description: The name of the Secure policy. It must be unique.

notificationChannels.description:
IDs of the notification channels to send alerts to
when the policy is fired.

ruleNames.description: Array with the name of the rules to match.

scope.description:
Limit appplication scope based in one expresion. For
example: "host.ip.private = \\"10.0.23.1\\"". By default the rule won't be scoped
and will target the entire infrastructure.

severity.description:
The severity of Secure policy. The accepted values
are: 0, 1, 2, 3 (High), 4, 5 (Medium), 6 (Low) and 7 (Info). The default value is 4 (Medium).

type.description: Specifies the type of the runtime policy. Must be one of: `falco`, `list_matching`, `k8s_audit`, `aws_cloudtrail`. By default it is `falco`.

sysdig:Secure/ruleFalco:RuleFalco.description:
## Import

Secure Falco runtime rules can be imported using the ID, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import sysdig:Secure/ruleFalco:RuleFalco example 12345
```

append.description: This indicates that the rule being created appends the condition to an existing Sysdig-provided rule. By default this is false. Appending to user-created rules is not supported by the API.

condition.description: A [Falco condition](https://falco.org/docs/rules/) is simply a Boolean predicate on Sysdig events expressed using the Sysdig [filter syntax](http://www.sysdig.org/wiki/sysdig-user-guide/#filtering) and macro terms.

description.description: The description of Secure rule. By default is empty.

exceptions.description: The exceptions key is a list of identifier plus list of tuples of filtercheck fields. See below for details.

name.description: The name of the exception. Only used to provide a handy name, and to potentially link together values in a later rule that has `append = true`.

output.description: Add additional information to each Falco notification's output. Required if append is false.

priority.description: The priority of the Falco rule. It can be: "emergency", "alert", "critical", "error", "warning", "notice", "info" or "debug". By default is "warning".

source.description: The source of the event. It can be either "syscall", "k8s_audit" or "aws_cloudtrail". Required if append is false.

tags.description: A list of tags for this rule.

version.description: Current version of the resource in Sysdig Secure.

sysdig:Secure/vulnerabilityException:Vul.description:
## Import

Vulnerability exception can be imported using the ID of the exception list, and the ID of the exception separated by `/`, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import sysdig:Secure/vulnerabilityException:VulnerabilityException example vulnexception_1iTWe5s3qFivOW4jcj5X8nnG3hn/vulnexceptionitem_1n1HL7la7LyJFAzr0DEc0hVbnFU
```

cve.description: The CVE ID to make an exception to.

enabled.description:
If this is false, the CVE exception will be ignored, use this if you don't want to delete
the exception. Default: true.

expirationDate.description:
The expiration date of the exception, useful if you want to ignore
some vulnerability only for a period of time. The time specified is Unix timestamp,
and must reference a date at 00:00:00 AM. See the example where the referenced date
is the 1st of January 2025. Default: 0 (no expiration date).

listId.description: The ID of the Vulnerability exception list to assign this exception to.

notes.description: Some context of why this vulnerability is being ignored.

Will be one of the following:  "EMAIL", "SNS", "OPSGENIE", 
"VICTOROPS", "WEBHOOK", "SLACK", "PAGER_DUTY".

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetTrustedCloudIdentity.

cloudProvider.description: The cloud provider in which the trusted identity will be used. Currently supported providers are `aws`, `gcp` and `azure`

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetTrustedCloudIdentity.

awsAccountId.description: If `identity` is an AWS ARN, this attribute contains the AWS Account ID to which the ARN belongs, otherwise it contains the empty string. `cloud_provider` must be equal to `aws` or `gcp`.

awsRoleName.description: If `identity` is a AWS IAM Role ARN, this attribute contains the name of the role, otherwise it contains the empty string. `cloud_provider` must be equal to `aws` or `gcp`.

azureServicePrincipalId.description: If `identity` contains credentials for an Azure Service Principal, this attribute contains the service principal's ID. `cloud_provider` must be equal to `azure`.

azureTenantId.description: If `identity` contains credentials for an Azure Service Principal, this attribute contains the service principal's Tenant ID. `cloud_provider` must be equal to `azure`.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

identity.description: Sysdig's identity (User/Role/etc) that should be used to create a trust relationship allowing Sysdig access to your cloud account.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetCurrentUser.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The user's first name.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetFargateWorkloadAgent.

collectorHost.description: The collector host to connect to.

collectorPort.description: The collector port to connect to.

containerDefinitions.description: The input Fargate container definitions to instrument with the Sysdig workload agent.

orchestratorHost.description: The orchestrator host to connect to.

orchestratorPort.description: The orchestrator port to connect to.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetFargateWorkloadAgent.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

outputContainerDefinitions.description: The updated container definitions instrumented with the Sysdig workload agent.
